      • expandDirectory

        public static java.lang.String[] expandDirectory(java.lang.String dir)
        Expand all JPG image file names from the given directory. If it is not a directory, but still has image extension, then return that in a one element array, else return null.

        public static java.awt.Dimension getScaledSize(java.awt.Dimension limits,
                               int w,
                               int h)
        Return the dimensions for the image when scaled to fit to the given limits. If the image is smaller than limits, it is not scaled.

      • getAnyScaledSize

        public static java.awt.Dimension getAnyScaledSize(java.awt.Dimension limits,
                                  int w,
                                  int h)
        Return the dimensions for the image when scaled to fit to the given limits, even if you'd had to scale upwards.

      • getRelativePath

        public static java.lang.String getRelativePath(java.io.File original,
                               java.io.File directory)
        Return a relative path to original as seen from given directory. It may be absolute if they are on different drives on Windows. All file separators will be '/' characters to make the path usable in HTML. e.g. \photos\foo\bar\photo.jpg and \photos\foo\xyz\ => ../bar/photo.jpg

      • showColorDialog

        public static java.awt.Color showColorDialog(java.awt.Component comp,
                             java.lang.String title,
                             java.awt.Color defaultColor)

      • copyStreamToFile

        public static boolean copyStreamToFile(java.io.InputStream in,
                       java.io.File target)
        Copy the contents of the given inputstream to given targetfile. The inputstream in closed after copy.

      • getCallingMethod

        public static java.lang.String getCallingMethod()
        Return the name of the method which called the method which called this method. This is useful for debugging.

      • drawWrappedText

        public static float drawWrappedText(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                    float x,
                    float y,
                    float width,
                    java.lang.String text)
        Draw given text to given Graphics2D view starting at x,y and wrapping lines at width pixels. If the y coordinate is negative, take it as maximum y position. Return new y.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
